properties.description: The image depicts a close-up view of the corner of an ornate picture frame. The frame is elaborately decorated with intricate carvings and patterns. The design includes a combination of floral and leaf motifs, with a series of raised, rounded shapes along the inner edge. The frame appears to be made of wood and is gilded, giving it a rich, golden appearance. The craftsmanship suggests it is a high-quality, possibly antique frame. The background is dark, which contrasts with the bright gold of the frame, highlighting its details.
properties.caption: Cardinal Fernando Niño de Guevara (1541–1609), El Greco (Domenikos Theotokopoulos) (Greek, Iráklion (Candia) 1541–1614 Toledo), Oil on canvas

properties.description: The image depicts a close-up view of a corner of a picture frame. The frame appears to be ornate and decorative, with intricate patterns and designs. The material of the frame looks like it could be wood with a gold or brass finish, giving it a luxurious and antique appearance. The corner of the frame shows detailed carvings or embossing, which adds to its ornate look. The background is dark, which helps to highlight the details of the frame. There is no text visible in the image.
properties.caption: Cardinal Fernando Niño de Guevara (1541–1609), El Greco (Domenikos Theotokopoulos) (Greek, Iráklion (Candia) 1541–1614 Toledo), Oil on canvas

properties.description: The image depicts a line drawing of a profile view of a decorative molding or trim piece. The design features a series of curves and intricate shapes, suggesting it is likely used in architectural detailing, such as crown molding or baseboard trim. The bottom part of the profile is a straight horizontal line, indicating the base of the molding, while the upper part consists of a series of ornate curves and indentations, giving it a classical and elegant appearance. The overall shape is symmetrical and appears to be designed for aesthetic enhancement in interior or exterior architectural applications. The background is plain white, which helps to highlight the details of the molding profile.
properties.caption: Cardinal Fernando Niño de Guevara (1541–1609), El Greco (Domenikos Theotokopoulos) (Greek, Iráklion (Candia) 1541–1614 Toledo), Oil on canvas

properties.description: The image depicts a seated figure dressed in elaborate, traditional clerical attire. The individual is wearing a long, flowing robe in a rich, deep red or purple color, which appears to be made of a luxurious fabric. The robe is adorned with intricate patterns and designs, suggesting a high level of craftsmanship. The figure also wears a matching hat, which is similarly ornate. The person is seated on a chair with a high back, and the background includes a textured wall and a partially visible door or panel. The floor is tiled in a checkered pattern, adding to the formal and historical ambiance of the scene. The overall composition and attire suggest that the figure is of significant religious or clerical importance, possibly a high-ranking church official. The detailed and formal nature of the clothing and setting indicates a portrait intended to convey authority and reverence.
properties.caption: Cardinal Fernando Niño de Guevara (1541–1609), El Greco (Domenikos Theotokopoulos) (Greek, Iráklion (Candia) 1541–1614 Toledo), Oil on canvas

properties.description: The image is a photograph of a framed painting. The painting depicts a seated figure, likely a man, dressed in elaborate, ornate clothing. The figure is wearing a long, flowing robe that appears to be made of rich, luxurious fabric, possibly silk or velvet, in shades of pink and purple. The robe is adorned with intricate patterns and details, suggesting a high status or religious significance. The figure is seated on a chair with a high back, and the background of the painting includes a patterned wall and a checkered floor. The chair and the setting contribute to the overall impression of opulence and grandeur. The frame of the painting is also quite elaborate, with a gold color and detailed carvings, adding to the sense of importance and value of the artwork. The painting appears to be in a museum or gallery setting, given the professional framing and display. Overall, the image conveys a sense of historical and artistic significance, with the subject likely being a person of high rank or importance, possibly a religious figure such as a bishop or cardinal.
properties.caption: Cardinal Fernando Niño de Guevara (1541–1609), El Greco (Domenikos Theotokopoulos) (Greek, Iráklion (Candia) 1541–1614 Toledo), Oil on canvas
